programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Prosecutors say the death of 16-year-old Neil Beagley was completely preventable; so much so his parents are charged with criminally negligent homicide.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Friends and family of Angie Zapata say she never hid from the men she dated that she was a transgender woman; Michael Andrade claims she did, and that the revelation drove him to brutally murder her.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: This new weekly signature newsmagazine series will bring viewers storytelling at its best from the archives of the Court TV library, incorporating the most popular cases in the vault past and present that have captured national attention.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: NFL star Kellen Winslow II seemingly had it all when he left the game behind, but five women came forward to accuse him of rape and other sex crimes.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.sub-title: From Verdict To A Second Trial
programme.desc: Judge Thomas Jackson finished with jury instructions in this case regarding the death of Thomas Hyde.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.sub-title: Second Trial Of Doctor Death Begins
programme.desc: The defense told jurors in Doctor Jack Kevorkian's latest trial that the two people who took their own lives did not want to die; Doctor Jack Kevorkian's lawyer said that this is not a criminal case.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The defense tried to show Doctor Jack Kevorkian was not a criminal and said he did nothing wrong; he was charged over the deaths of two people who had taken their own lives; the state started its case with first responders.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: First responders told the Court about their roles on the scene of the deaths of two people, linked to this case; one had Lou Gehrig's Disease and the other had a type of bone cancer.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Jurors in the trial of Doctor Death saw the evidence from the case, including a gas canister; Kevorkian was charged over the death of two people who took their own lives in 1993 when Michigan's assisted-suicide ban was in place.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.sub-title: Kiling A Person Or Ending Pain?
programme.desc: A police detective told jurors in Doctor Jack Kevorkian's trial about the investigation into the deaths of the two people linked to this case; so far, the state had called multiple first responders.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The daughter of Merian Frederick watched the video of her late mother's meeting with Doctor Jack Kevorkian; that tape is in evidence in his trial over two deaths in 1993.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.sub-title: The Pain Of A Dying Mother
programme.desc: Before she reached out to the defendant to end her suffering from ALS, Frederick communicated with her daughter by typing into a telephone for the deaf because her muscles in her arms and hands had diminished.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury learns more graphic details of what was inside the suitcases where Bill's remains had been found; prosecutors believe Melanie McGuire wanted her husband to simply disappear.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: Investigators in the crime lab took the remains of Bill McGuire found in the three suitcases and were able to process them in order for the medical examiner to do the autopsy.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Crime Scene Technician Wraps Up Testimony
programme.desc: The cross-examination began on the crime scene technician; the focus was on Bill McGuire's remains that had been found in three different suitcases near Chesapeake Bay in Virginia; more than 300 miles south of where Bill was last seen alive.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury gets full graphic description of what was in each of the three suitcases; they learn how police began their murder investigation, which led them to arrest Melanie McGuire for first-degree murder.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: When Virginia Detectives Showed up in New Jersey
programme.desc: Jurors get more details about the police investigation into Bill McGuire's death; detectives get in touch with Melanie McGuire who was eventually accused of murder; the first detective who worked the homicide of Bill McGuire was from Virginia Beach.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Observing Melanie Mcguire in Her Interview
programme.desc: The Defense has more questions for the first investigator working the death of Bill McGuire; the jury hears about Melanie's actions during the first initial interview she had with police after the remains of her husband had been identified.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Guns Shop Owner to Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Prosecutors accusing Melanie McGuire of killing her husband, Bill, bring in a gun shop owner to testify; The State claims the bullets found in Bill's remains had been linked to a gun the defendant brought.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: On the stand is the medical examiner who tells the court about examining the remains of Bill McGuire each time another suitcase was recovered; the jury hears graphic details about Bill's remains.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Tracing The Path Of The Bullet
programme.desc: Prosecutors call upon the expertise of a firearms examiner; investigators were able to link the bullet found in Bill McGuire's remains to the same gun that his wife, Melanie, bought just two days before he vanished.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors shift the jury's attention to the fertility clinic where she worked; investigators say they found a number of products and supplies linked to the murder of Bill McGuire that could have come from someone in the medical field.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: The second detective who interviewed Melanie McGuire days after her husband's remains were identified testifies; this time, the investigator is from New Jersey and not Virginia.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: A Different Side of Bill Mcguire
programme.desc: A forensic ballistics expert on the stand explains the bullets found inside Bill's remains; a close friend of Bill's tells the jury more about his character and behavior.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Tyler Hadley discusses how he, as a troubled 17-year-old, bludgeoned his mother and father to death with a hammer.
